sub_title: Senior Monitoring Officer at OSCE Mission in Skopje
summary: Senior-level professional with over twenty years of experience in human rights, social development and good governance for the benefit of marginalized and disadvantaged groups, such as women, youth, religious and ethnic minorities, refugees; experienced on the management of teams and projects and the development of human resources, including the submission of grand proposals and raising of funds; expert on gender issues, especially on combating gender-based violence and counselling for women on career development (employment and entrepreneurship) and the development of gender-sensitive state policies. Established record in research, adult training on human rights, social integration and development and observation of elections.

education.degree_name: Joint European Master’s Degree in Human Rights and Democratization  (E.MA.)

education.field_of_study: Classical Studies, Greek / Latin Language and Literature, Linguistics, History, Philosophy

certifications.name: Career Counselling
certifications.authority: Vocational Training Centre (KEK EKEKA), Thessaloniki, Greece

certifications.name: Human Resources Expert
certifications.authority: National Workforce Organization, Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs of Greece

profile_positions.description: Under the direction of the Chief of Monitoring Unit and performs the following tasks: leading the Skopje-based Monitoring team; ensuring coordination with the Monitoring team based in Tetovo; and contributing to the development of the Monitoring Units policies and practices; ensuring that the Skopje-based Monitoring team operates in line with standard operating procedures and instructions; providing internal training and mentoring to members of the Unit; monitoring, assessing and analysing the political, inter-ethnic and security situation in the Area of Responsibility (AoR); co-ordinating with other departments in the Mission, keeping them informed of monitoring activities within the AoR; in rotation with the Senior Monitoring Officer from the Tetovo team, standing in for the Chief of the Monitoring Unit in his/her absence; supervising the work of 4 international and 4 national staff; performing other duties as required.
profile_positions.title: Senior Monitoring Officer

profile_positions.description: Member of the Human Rights Consultancy firm based in the Netherlands, offering consultancy on Human Rights issues, and post conflict related matters such as participation of women, elections, displacement and civil affairs. Geographic coverage includes Afghanistan, Sahel region in Africa and the Balkans.
profile_positions.title: Conslultant

profile_positions.description: Review applications received by the UN Trust Fund as part of the Fund’s Technical Review Group (TRG). Familiarize  with the UN Trust Fund’s application and funding criteria, provide narrative assessment and quantitative scoring for brief concept note applications assigned to the Technical Reviewer and enter data into the Fund’s online grants management system.
profile_positions.title: UN Trust Fund  (Actions to Eliminate Violence against Women) Technical Reviewer

profile_positions.description: Research activity conducted as member of the research team of the “UNESCO Chair in Women, Peace and Security: Building Capacity and Resilience through Education and Research” of UOM, on the subject of women’s protection and advancement, especially in the context of teaching courses related to conflict resolution and strategic studies.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Assigned as Senior Officer at refugee camp in Northern Greece to ensure response work with clients, including case management and psychosocial interventions; support staff professional development and foster a positive team spirit to ensure quality programming; identify training needs for Community Outreach Workers and support organization and facilitation of training to meet those needs; prepare and maintain/update work plans that support activities; liaise and cooperate with internal and external stakeholders, including international organizations and NGOs, governmental institutions and service providers; prepare and submit weekly, monthly and three-month reports and incorporate supervisor feedback as requested.
profile_positions.title: Women’s Protection and Empowerment Senior Officer

profile_positions.description: Contracted agent, responsible for building the institutional capacity of the Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development of Afghanistan (MRRD) on gendered research methods. Part of the assignment was to conduct capacity needs assessment, develop a gender research training manual and toolkit and train trainers of MRRD Departments and Programmes on the developed training manual.
profile_positions.title: Research Capacity Development Consultant/ Gender expert

profile_positions.description:
•	Senior Human Rights Officer and Acting Regional Director, Peje/Pec (2-7. 2011, 6-8. 2009).

Identify, monitor, analyze and report Human Rights (HR) issues in Peje/Pec Region, with special emphasis on minority and women’s issues. Design strategies, projects and capacity building programs. Supervise Regional Centre (RC) Human Dimension Officers. Liaise and cooperate with international and local counterparts. Replace RC Director in his absence. As Acting Regional Director, determined RC strategy, policies and programs, supervised operations and 60 staff members.
profile_positions.title: Senior Human Rights Officer and Acting Regional Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Human Dimension Officer, Mitrovice/-a

Monitored, analyzed and reported HR issues; drafted recommendations, designed strategies and projects to resolve issues; identified capacity-building needs of local officials; drafted fund-raising proposals for the promotion of human rights; liaised with international and local counterparts; provided technical guidance to local institutions.
profile_positions.title: Human Dimension Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Project Officer (11.2006 – 3.2007).  Provided technical assistance for the implementation of projects funded by the European Union supporting academic research. Identified needs of project managers and participants, drafted proposals and assisted in fund raising. Monitored project implementation, compliance with terms of funding and project evaluation; prepared reports and operational documents; coordinated activities with donors and funding institutions.

•	Gender Expert – Trainer, Project Supervisor (3.2005 – 2.2006)  In cooperation with the Greek Ministry of Education, implemented training project for high school teachers and career counsellors on employment policies with the gender aspect; educated and informed trainees; supervised and coordinated the implementation of interventional programs in schools; organised workshops, provided briefings, drafted reports, conducted evaluation and follow up of projects; produced educational materials; organised campaign events.
profile_positions.title: Trainer and Project Manager / Gender Expert

company.name: Greek Ministry of Internal Affairs, Research Centre for Gender Equality (KETHI)

profile_positions.company: Greek Ministry of Internal Affairs, Research Centre for Gender Equality (KETHI)
profile_positions.description:
•	Gender Officer – Researcher, Career Counsellor

Planned, implemented and monitored projects for women’s advancement and integration in the labour market; organized capacity building trainings and career planning workshops; provided counselling to women on issues of social integration, career orientation and entrepreneurship; coordinated activities with the Ministry of Labour for the formation of employment strategies at national level for the enhancement of women; designed projects for combating gender based violence and trafficking of women; conducted research and provided documentation; produced educational materials and counselling tools; organized campaigns; sensitized and trained agencies, groups and individuals on gender issues. During the period 09.2003-03.2005 in cooperation with the Greek Ministry of Education implemented nation-wide project for training, educating and sensitizing public education teachers on gender rights and career orientation; supported the implementation of interventional programs in public schools; organised work-groups; drafted reports, conducted evaluation and follow up of the programme; drafted tools and educational materials; organised campaign events.
profile_positions.title: Gender Officer – Researcher, Career Counsellor

company.name: “Herakleitus” Network (Municipalities - Prefecture of Thessaloniki - Greek Manpower Organization)

profile_positions.company: “Herakleitus” Network (Municipalities - Prefecture of Thessaloniki - Greek Manpower Organization)
profile_positions.description:
•	Career Counsellor (03.1997– 02.1999, 01.2000-09.2001)  

Supported persons facing social exclusion (women, youth, immigrants, asylum seekers, minorities and other socially excluded groups) in career planning and integration in the labour market; provided counselling, organised workshops on capacity building and career planning; developed and operated a pilot business-network program providing employment opportunities, and a data base system on employment services; produced counselling tools, drafted reports, conducted research and project evaluation; participated in work-groups and liaised with NGOs, governmental organizations and private institutions for the creation of a network of counselling centres; collected information on the local labour market and services provided by other organizations.
profile_positions.title: Career Counsellor

company.name: Rehabilitation Centre for Victims of Torture and Other Forms of Abuse

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteer work: provided information and social assistance to refugees, asylum seekers and victims torture and other forms of abuse; organized network of volunteers; provide documentation; filed reports.
